lines: Your husband has just purchased a $3000 satellite dish but refuses to purchase a new washing machine because that would be "frivolous."
#DO NOTHING/ IT ISN'T WORTH MAKING A BIG DEAL OVER
Your Gentleness characteristic suggests that you tend to be condescending and critical in situations like this. Even though you have a valid point, you put him on the defensive and argue over it.
He understands your point but still believes he was justified in spending the money. How do you feel?
You are entitled to your feelings. You hear him call in from the other room, "Hey, Honey, come on in. There's a great nature special coming in from Tibet."
The show, broadcast in a language that sounds like clanging pots, shows the myriad uses of yak dung.
I can understand why you are angry, but yelling rarely solves anything. Do you feel better now that you have yelled?
Good. Let me tell you, it didn't help your marriage any. But...
Well, don't be too hard on yourself. Anyone can slip and lose her temper.
What an attitude! You must be either very rich or deep in debt already. Of course, you could also be tolerant, patient, wonderful and loving, which I will assume you are!
By the way, you have to foot the bill for a new washer yourself.
